newsitem.title: USA: NU sees power back today for all Conn. users.
newsitem.headline: NU sees power back today for all Conn. users.

text.p: Northeast Utilities (NU) said Tuesday it hoped to restore power service to all Connecticut customers later today after a weekend storm pounded the state and the rest of New England last weekend.
"We still have 1,000 customers out," said NU spokeswoman Myra Humphrey, adding most of those were in Fairfield County near the New York state border.
At the peak of the outage, 92,000 customers were without electricity, she said.
Thus far, heavy winds and torrential rain from the weekend nor'easter knocked down 125 of its poles, damaged 135 transformers and over a hundred sections of overhead power lines, she said.
Humphrey said major transmission and generation facilities were unharmed by the storm.
NU, via its Connecticut Lighting and Power Co subsidiary, serves 149 of the 169 communities in Connecticut.
